title: Beasley
content:
I swear I have seen this before, but I can't find it nor can What's the Font. The font in question is the word Beasley. Please help.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831111328im_/http:/typophile.com/files/20131101_121423_3493.jpg)
author: glenwood

comments.content:
Apparently picture went crazy. Try this one

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831111328im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Beasley_5468.jpg)

Thanks for the better pic.  
I had to download your original pic to make any sense of it. I edited it to look like this:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831111328im_/http:/typophile.com/files/UnknownStencil107244_3502.jpg)
  
I looked at various stencil fonts and none were a good match either for a base font or choice of where to make the stencil gaps.  
I suspect this is custom logo work.  
Anyway the base font is close to Helvetica Neue Black.  
I did some cuts and minor further editing of A and the result looks like this:  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831111328im_/http:/typophile.com/files/HelveticaNeueBlackStencil_5283.jpg)
  
Pretty close.  
You could do the same to reproduce this part of the logo.  
Don

The closest I have is [AG Book Stencil BQ](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831111328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/ag-book-stencil-bq). More alternatives: [Cargo D](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831111328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/cargo), [Arston Stencil](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831111328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/applyinteractive/arston-stencil)
